alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Suffolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 3:52PM EDT until September 16 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT SUNDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 2 PM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 3 to 12 feet in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways (10.2 to 11.8 feet Mean Lower Low Water). * WHERE...Eastern Essex MA, Suffolk MA, Eastern Norfolk MA and Eastern Plymouth MA Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 11 AM EDT Sunday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from midnight tonight to 2 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. && Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
